snippet: Kwame Kwei-Armah has written a play inspired by “A Raisin in the Sun” that is being staged in repertory with “Clybourne Park” at CenterStage in Baltimore under the umbrella title “The Raisin Cycle.”
abstract: Kwame Kwei-Armah play Beneatha's Place, inspired by A Raisin in the Sun, is being staged in repertory with Clybourne Park at CenterStage in Baltimore under umbrella title The Raisin Cycle; bold move of staging controversial plays in context is gamble for CenterStage's new artistic director, but one he can afford to make at thriving theater.
lead_paragraph: Kwame Kwei-Armah has written a play inspired by “A Raisin in the Sun” that is being staged in repertory with “Clybourne Park” at CenterStage in Baltimore under the umbrella title “The Raisin Cycle.”

headline.seo: ‘The Raisin Cycle’ at CenterStage in Baltimore
headline.main: For Sons of ‘Raisin,’ a Back-to-Back Duel
headline.print_headline: For Sons of ‘Raisin,’ a Back-to-Back Duel
